title: Banning Handgun Sales to People Under 21 Is Ruled Unconstitutional
summary: The 2-1 appeals court decision, overturning restriction initially passed by Congress in 1960s, marks first time a high-level court has extended right to bear arms to people under 21. A divided federal appeals court on Tuesday held that the federal government may not bar federally licensed gun dealers from selling handguns to law-abiding citizens under 21 years old, potentially setting up the issue for the U.S. Supreme Court to decide.

title: Wildfires, Heat Sweep Across Much of U.S. West
summary: Temperatures remain high in many places as firefighters battle more than 50 large blazes. Firefighters battled dozens of blazes across the drought-stricken West as hot temperatures persisted in some areas and officials warned of gusty winds that could hinder firefighting efforts.

title: Texas Senate Passes Voting Bill, as Democratic Rivals Push Federal Bill
summary: The Texas House voted to arrest Democrats who fled to Washington to kill the voting bill. AUSTIN, Texas-The Texas Senate advanced a bill imposing stricter voting rules Tuesday, a day after their Democratic counterparts in the state House fled the state to prevent the bill's final passage.

title: ZoomInfo Technologies Using New Financing to Help Pay for AI Startup
summary: The business-intelligence platform, which is buying Chorus.ai for $575 million, on Tuesday raised about $500 million in debt. Business-intelligence platform ZoomInfo Technologies Inc. raised about $500 million in debt on Tuesday and plans to use some of the funds to buy an artificial-intelligence startup, a deal that comes on the heels of a record-breaking first half of the year for mergers and acquisitions involving U.S. companies.

title: For the Real Key West, Follow the Locals
summary: From seafront restaurants with dinner 'theater' to a lighthouse that you can have all to yourself, here are a few hidden treasures recommended by discriminating locals. We are delighted that you'd like to resume your subscription.

title: Joe Biden, Jim Crow and Texas Voting
summary: His escalating rhetoric is meant to justify the unjustifiable, H.R.1.. The Democratic narrative on voting is becoming unglued. "The 21st-century Jim Crow assault is real," President Biden claimed Tuesday. "We're facing the most significant test of our democracy since the Civil War-that's not hyperbole," he said in the same speech. "The Confederates back then never breached the Capitol, as insurrectionists did on January the 6th."

title: Powell Gets His Inflation
summary: 'Transitory' price increases are now up 5.4% year-over-year.. How do you define transitory? Three months? A year? Or is it two? Inquiring minds want to know after Tuesday's report that the consumer price index rose 0.9% in June. Consumer prices are now up 5.4% from a year earlier, so what the Federal Reserve means when it dismisses these price increases as "transitory" takes on growing economic and political significance.

title: Cuba's Communists Strike Back
summary: The regime has rounded up the usual democratic suspects and more.. As the world's attention moves away from Cuba and its Sunday protests, we shouldn't forget the brave individuals being rounded up and brutalized by the government of Miguel Díaz-Canel.

summary: The cruise operator plans to restart U.S. cruises in August with a 100% vaccination policy. title: Biden's Shrewd Infrastructure Strategy
summary: The split bill is good for him. It complicates life and minimizes losses for congressional Democrats.. President Biden's insistence on splitting his infrastructure package into two bills-one bipartisan, the second to be passed along party lines-is good for him but will make life complicated for congressional Democrats. Mr. Biden can get credit for trying to enact his party's most extreme positions, while not paying the price for succeeding politically as Barack Obama did in 2010.

title: Biden Can Make Up for Obama's Libya Neglect
summary: A diplomatic push for fair elections in December would serve U.S. interests.. Joe Biden has a chance to make amends.

title: 'Tata' Review: From Homestead to Hegemony
summary: No company has dominated national commerce as much as the Tata Group in India. Yet it has been family-run for most of its existence.. Drive on any highway in India-which you'd do only if your craving for risk matched your appetite for hot naan-and chances are that a perilously laden truck will hurtle past you with the words "OK Tata" painted on its rear fenders. In this signature slogan of the country's roads, the second word is a pun playing on the way Indians say goodbye to each other as well as on the name of the venerable business group that made the truck.

title: Realism About Vaccine Hesitancy
summary: Hyperbolic Fox anchors at least recognize the law of diminishing returns.. Watching my teams lose is often more compelling than watching the Fox evening lineup, but I was nonetheless doubtful when a New York Times headline claimed "Fox News hosts smear America's vaccination efforts."

summary: It may resemble a serious academic discipline, but it's really just a fancy argument for racial preferences.. title: Christie's Sells $3.5 Billion of Art in First Half of 2021
summary: Art market roars back as crypto-collectors and millennials in Asia drive sales on everything from NFTs to blue-chip art. After a turbulent year, Christie's said Tuesday that millennials in Asia and cryptocurrency collectors are splurging on blue-chip art, bidding up everything from jewelry to Jean-Michel Basquiat.

title: Italy Moves to Ban Cruise Vessels to Venice
summary: The lucrative traffic has boosted Venice's economy, but critics say waves erode the foundations of historic waterfront buildings. title: 'Treasure of Love' by the Flatlanders and 'Welcome to Countryland' by Flatland Cavalry Reviews: Pleasures From Wide Open Spaces
summary: Two groups hailing from Lubbock, Texas-one an American classic and the other an up-and-coming regional favorite-release records that pay tribute to their country roots.. A longstanding source of amusement among Texas music aficionados is the title chosen for a posthumous collection of country-tinged Buddy Holly recordings-"Holly in the Hills." Anyone even remotely familiar with the territory around his native Lubbock, where those recordings were made, a decade earlier, knows there are no green Appalachian-style hills in sight, the area being famously arid and flat.

title: Broadcom No Longer in Talks to Buy SAS
summary: A deal by the chip maker would have valued closely held SAS in the range of $15 billion to $20 billion. Talks for Broadcom Inc. to buy SAS Institute Inc. have ended after the founders of the closely held software company changed their minds about a sale, people familiar with the matter said.

title: Record Natural Gas Prices Give Power Markets a Jolt
summary: Chinese demand, heat in the Pacific Northwest and drought in Brazil create pockets of scarcity for the key electricity-generating fuel. A scramble for natural gas is creating pockets of scarcity in the global market, boosting prices for the fuel and for the electricity generated by burning it.

title: Automation Anywhere's New CIO Aims to Bring More Bots In-House
summary: Sumit Johar takes over effort to automate startup's internal business processes. Automation Anywhere Inc. named software industry veteran Sumit Johar as its new chief information officer, as the startup employs its own automation tools to improve internal operations.

title: Biden Blasts New State GOP Voting Restrictions
summary: Administration has limited options to expand voter access without getting rid of Senate filibuster, and hopes to build pressure on lawmakers ahead of next year's midterm elections. PHILADELPHIA-President Biden blasted efforts in Republican-controlled states to tighten voting rules and called on Congress to advance stalled legislation in a speech Tuesday, as he faces pressure from some Democrats and activists to do more to curb GOP-backed election-law changes.

title: Commerce Department to Tap Former Pentagon Official for Export-Control Post
summary: Alan Estevez will oversee a bureau at the forefront of dealing with heightened U.S.-China tensions over advanced technology. title: Biden to Nominate Former Arizona Sen. Flake as Ambassador to Turkey
summary: Republican said in his 2017 retirement speech that he deemed Trump's conduct as president 'dangerous to a democracy'. President Biden intends to nominate former Arizona Republican Sen. Jeff Flake to serve as ambassador to Turkey, the White House said.

summary: The increase in the June consumer-price index surprised investors and analysts. U.S. stocks fell and bond yields rose Tuesday as investors recoiled from another hot inflation report and earnings out of some big banks.

title: Inside This Beverly Hills Family Room, Glamour and Practicality Meet Halfway
summary: The $90,300 space brings 'glitz and glamour,' but also durability for everyday use. Ryan Saghian's client's directive for the interiors of their 15,500-square-foot Victorian home in Beverly Hills was simple: "They wanted glitz and glamour," he said. The request seemed appropriate for a grand, 6-bedroom, 8-bathroom home a stone's throw from the swank Beverly Hills Hotel.

title: JPMorgan's Jamie Dimon Says the U.S. Consumer Is Raring to Go
summary: Bank frees up more money in second quarter as it continues to emerge from last year's Covid recession. JPMorgan Chase & Co. said second-quarter profit surged and customer spending is returning to pre-pandemic levels, evidence of a strong economic recovery that shows few signs of slowing.

title: OPEC+ Uncertainty, Virus Variant Worries Linger in Oil Market, IEA Says
summary: International Energy Agency adds that deepening supply deficit could put pressure on economic recovery. The recent failure of OPEC and its allies to agree on a plan to ease production cuts in August means oil-market investors face the contradictory worries of both undersupply and oversupply, the International Energy Agency said Tuesday.

title: 'Friends: The Reunion' Review: The One With a Big Dose of Sentimentality
summary: An HBO Max reunion special features not only Jennifer Aniston, Courteney Cox, Lisa Kudrow, Matt LeBlanc, Matthew Perry and David Schwimmer but David Beckham, Malala and more.. 'It's about that time in your life when your friends are your family," producer David Crane recalls during the unabashedly sentimental "Friends: The Reunion," describing the "one-sentence pitch" that he and co-creator Marta Kauffman devised for their famously popular sitcom, birthed on Sept. 22, 1994. If you were living through that particular time of your life during the 10-year run of "Friends," the show might hold the same place in your heart that the Beatles do for Boomers.

title: South African Violence Reflects Inequalities Exacerbated by Pandemic
summary: Unrest triggered by the arrest of former President Jacob Zuma risks worsening the surge in coronavirus infections, causing food insecurity. JOHANNESBURG-Violence and looting in parts of South Africa, triggered by the arrest of former President Jacob Zuma, are broadening to reflect more deep-seated problems in the continent's most developed economy, where a third pandemic lockdown is exacerbating economic pain and joblessness that has disproportionately affected the poor.

title: Fire in Coronavirus Hospital in Iraq Kills at Least 86 People
summary: Blaze is the second in a Covid-19 facility in Iraq in less than three months, adding to pressure on government. BAGHDAD-A fire caused by an exploding oxygen canister killed at least 86 people in a hospital treating Covid-19 patients in southern Iraq late Monday in the second lethal blaze in a coronavirus facility in the country in less than three months, according to Iraqi officials..

title: 'Mare of Easttown' Review: All Gone but Not Forgotten
summary: In an HBO drama, Kate Winslet stars as a small-town detective haunted by her tragic past and the unsolved disappearance of a local girl. The title of this sterling drama set in a small Pennsylvania town is a clear sign of things to come. "Mare of Easttown" (begins Sunday, 10 p.m., HBO) is, namely, a seven-part series whose powers derive as much from its enthralling focus on that town and its society as from the unsteady life and career of its heroine, known simply as Mare, a police detective born and raised there.

title: Pièces de Résistance (Wednesday Crossword, July 14)

summary: Taliban warn Ankara that Turkish troops will be dealt with as 'occupiers' if they remain. title: 'WandaVision' Review: Less Than a Modern Marvel
summary: Starring Elizabeth Olsen and Paul Bettany, the Marvel Cinematic Universe's foray into old-time TV gets the genre right, but not much else.. Even those viewers fully indoctrinated into the Marvel Cinematic Universe and its intersecting adventures, rococo mythologies and legion of superheroes may be confused by "WandaVision." They'll be wondering, among other things, why the characters themselves aren't more visibly confused: If you found yourself in a postmodern remake of "The Dick Van Dyke Show," not knowing how you got there or why, wouldn't you discuss it with your spouse? If only to get your stories straight?

title: Guillain-Barré Syndrome and the J&J Vaccine: What to Know and What Are the Risks
summary: A haywire immune system, attacking healthy nerves, causes the disorder. U.S. health authorities added a warning to the label of J&J's Covid-19 vaccine after finding 100 reports.. Johnson & Johnson added a warning to the label for the company's Covid-19 vaccine, cautioning that there was a very low risk of people developing a nerve disorder after getting the shot. Here's what you need to know about the disorder, known as Guillain-Barré Syndrome.

title: Where Are All the Restaurant Workers? Some Have Moved On
summary: Many hospitality workers found jobs in new industries after Covid-19 forced restaurants, hotels and bars to close. Restaurants are calling former employees back to work, but not all of them are ready to return. The leisure and hospitality sector has long had the lowest wages for nonsupervisory roles among major industries, according to the Labor Department, and many workers have taken their talents to higher-paying industries with more stability. title: The New Photo Album? Video Apps That Montage Your Life
summary: People are increasingly relying on apps like TikTok and 1 Second Everyday to sync bite-size home videos to the beat of a song. Here, how to make your own modern video diary.. IN THE MIDST of New York City's lockdown, Grey Vila, an artist who uses gender-neutral pronouns, was stuck an hour and a half away from their girlfriend. To cope with the separation, the pair began editing minute-long video tributes to their relationship, using TikTok to collage snippets of footage from their pre-pandemic life together. Once the reunited couple could record again, the montages multiplied. Set to upbeat music, they mirror the credits of a coming-of-age film: skateboards going down a ramp; a flash of the Williamsburg Bridge; a fruit-laden picnic blanket. "It makes you feel good about yourself and what you do with your time," said Mx. Vila, 20.

title: Team USA's Family Section for the Tokyo Olympics Will Be in Orlando
summary: With overseas spectators banned, the USOPC, NBCUniversal and two sponsors are sending family and friends of Olympic athletes to watch from afar at a resort. With the Tokyo Olympics banning foreign spectators-and nearly all others-from watching the Games in person, the U.S. Olympic & Paralympic Committee, NBCUniversal and two sponsors are paying to send athletes' closest friends and family to a remote viewing-and-cheering hub at an NBCU resort in Orlando.

Fantasy franchise spinoffs and other escapist fare made a big showing Tuesday in the nominations for the 73rd Emmy Awards. Disney+ Star Wars series "The Mandalorian" tied Netflix 's costume drama "The Crown" for the most nominations: 24. "WandaVision," also on Disney+, came in second with 23 total nominations for the Marvel superhero tale set in a world of vintage sitcoms.

title: Innovation Moves to Middle America
summary: Migration of entrepreneurs may yield fewer photo-sharing apps and more practical solutions.. Zionsville, Ind., a town of about 30,000, is a few hours south of Flint, Mich., by car. So when evidence emerged in 2014 that Flint's water supply was dangerously contaminated, a Zionsville business executive, Megan Glover, began looking into ways to test the water coming from her own family's tap. What she uncovered surprised her-not that the local supply was contaminated, but that a testing kit typically cost $3,000, an exorbitant amount most families in her neighborhood would never consider. So Ms. Glover did the most American thing possible: She researched the issue, developed a more affordable alternative, founded a company, sought out investors (my venture firm among them) and emerged as CEO of 120Water, a successful enterprise that now helps monitor the quality of the nation's water supply. (Zionsville's water turned out to be clean.)

title: Budget Deficit Narrowed in First Nine Months of Fiscal Year
summary: Treasury says revenue rose 35% to $3.1 trillion from October through June compared with a year earlier. The U.S. budget deficit narrowed to $2.2 trillion during the first nine months of the fiscal year from the same period a year earlier, with the gap between spending and revenue shrinking as the recovery from the pandemic-induced slump boosted tax collections.

title: U.S. Slows Antiterrorist Campaign in Somalia as It Considers New Policy

title: Lina Khan Is Icarus at the FTC
summary: The antitrust offensive and power grab will end with her wings melting in the courts.. It's a touch ominous when a bureaucrat begins her tenure by sending bipartisan procedural safeguards to the paper shredder. Federal Trade Commission Chairman Lina Khan wasted no time making confetti of the guardrails at the FTC, including the Obama administration policy statement placing minimal limits on how the agency could use its theretofore undefined power to police "unfair methods of competition." Shredding the statement clears the way for Ms. Khan's attempt to remake antitrust law in her image ("Lina Khan's Power Grab at the FTC," Review & Outlook, July 6). With the announcement of a global gag order on FTC staff, Ms. Khan has made it clear the FTC will now speak with one voice-hers.

title: Trump Lawsuit Tests the First Amendment
summary: The government must not be able to pressure social-media platforms into handling the news in the way the president prefers.. Donald Trump's lawsuit against Big Tech is without merit ("Why I'm Suing Big Tech," op-ed, July 9). The First Amendment does not apply to commercial contracts between private persons like the user agreements Mr. Trump entered into with social-media companies. Mr. Trump was barred from using the companies' platforms because he violated the terms of his agreements. His sound and fury over his removal signify nothing. All kinds of commercial contracts limit one party's speech rights. Mr. Trump knows this. He imposes censorship through the nondisclosure provisions in contracts he enters into with employees and others all the time.

title: The IRS Reads the Bible and Reveals Its Bias
summary: A bureaucrat examined our religion and declared it Republican.. William McGurn ("Defund Joe Biden's IRS," Main Street, July 6) and Holman W. Jenkins, Jr. ("The IRS is ProPublica's Accessory," Business World, July 7) articulate theoretical dangers from the IRS that my organization experienced in reality.

title: Critical Race Theory Has a Racism Problem
summary: From the idea that white people are congenitally disabled by virtue of being born white to the bigotry of low expectations.. The idea that white people are congenitally disabled by virtue of being born white and must receive therapy by learning tenets of critical race theory is a racist and preposterous belief ("Battle Over Critical Race Theory," Christopher F. Rufo, op-ed, June 28). If it weren't so dangerous-especially with the bigotry of low expectations implicit in the theory's teaching that absent the scaffold of white self-abasement, African-Americans will not achieve their full potential-the whole enterprise would be comical. Most Americans, white and black, pursue a one-day-at-a-time pace, trying to keep their loved ones safe, fed and happy. Now we will have to add hurdling progressive charlatans to the daily grind.

title: Jeff Bezos's Climate Indulgences
summary: The Amazon billionaire tries to save the planet from himself.. title: Ceiling Wallpaper: An Interior Design Move That's Topping the Trend List
summary: As designers and DIYers look for a finishing flourish and a way to visually expand a room, they're adding pattern to the ceiling-known as the fifth wall. "Paint splatter and markers often end up all over the walls," said the attorney turned design consultant in Dripping Springs, Texas. "We decided to install wallpaper on the ceiling only." summary: A new theory that reactivated older viruses are driving some of the coronavirus's debilitating symptoms is gaining traction among some patient advocates. More long Covid-19 patients are pushing to investigate what they believe is fueling some of their debilitating long-term symptoms: dormant viruses that have been reactivated by the coronavirus.

title: BC Partners Acquires Major Stake in Digital-Services Agency Valtech
summary: Deal values the London-based company, which counts L'Oreal and PepsiCo among its clients, at $1.4 billion. Private-equity firm BC Partners is acquiring a significant stake in Valtech SE as part of a deal valuing the digital-services agency at $1.4 billion, according to the companies, a bet that brands will increasingly rely on technology and data to retain existing customers and win new ones.

title: Top U.S. Commander in Afghanistan Steps Down From Post
summary: Army Gen. Scott Miller relinquishes command at military headquarters in Kabul amid deteriorating security situation. KABUL-The top U.S. commander in Afghanistan stepped down from the post Monday, marking a symbolic end to the American role in the war as Afghan security forces position themselves to defend critical cities across the country against a Taliban onslaught.

title: Google to Help Insurers Measure Slip-and-Fall Risks in Buildings
summary: BlueZoo will place sensors in buildings that will send occupancy data to Google Cloud for analysis. Google is aiming to help small-business insurers more accurately measure occupancy of buildings where they are on the hook for slip-and-fall accidents and other risks.

title: OPEC Spat Spotlights Saudi Arabia's Struggle to Kick Oil Dependency
summary: The kingdom under Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman vowed to create vital non-oil industries. It hasn't happened.. RIYADH-Saudi Arabia's crown prince pledged five years ago to unshackle the economy from oil by 2020. But as the world's top crude exporter seeks to maintain growth and generate jobs, the kingdom is redoubling its commitment to hydrocarbons and veering away from greener energy sources.

title: Yellen Says EU Delay on Digital Tax Helps Global Corporate-Tax Deal
summary: Treasury secretary says coming negotiations should clarify what levies are allowed, broadly supports EU carbon border tax. BRUSSELS-Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen thanked European officials for delaying work on a controversial tax on digital services, saying coming negotiations on a proposed global minimum corporate tax should clarify what levies might be allowed.

title: Single Amazon Warehouse Aims to Go Public
summary: ROX Financial wants to list the Bay Area facility and add more Amazon fulfillment centers if the IPO succeeds. A startup is attempting to create something that U.S. real-estate executives say doesn't exist in their industry today: a public company that owns only one property.

title: GM Bets on a Return to Office With New California Campus
summary: 'Virtual work can only get you so far,' says a General Motors executive as auto maker plans a new design and tech campus. General Motors Co. plans to expand its offices in Southern California with the opening of a new tech campus next year, reinforcing its need for additional physical space as many companies shift more permanently to remote work.

title: Owner of QVC and HSN Hires David Rawlinson as Its Next CEO
summary: E-commerce executive tapped to run retailer looking to adapt after pandemic. The parent of QVC and HSN has hired David Rawlinson II as its next chief executive, as the cable-TV and online retailer seeks to adapt to changing consumer habits.

title: Olympics Sponsors Spent Big Bucks, but Their Plans Are Falling Flat
summary: No-spectator rule limits marketing opportunities for Japanese companies that paid more than $3 billion to back the Games. TOKYO-When Asahi Breweries pledged more than $100 million to sponsor the Olympics in Japan, it envisaged stadiums of spectators from around the world chugging the "Tokyo 2020 Official Beer" and a spillover of favorable publicity.

title: United and Mesa to Buy Electric Planes for Short Trips
summary: The deal for 200 electric aircraft developed by Sweden's Heart Aerospace is the latest bet on new technology to curb emissions. United Airlines Holdings Inc. and a regional airline partner are hoping to use a new electric plane to revitalize short-haul flying.

title: J&J, AstraZeneca Explore Covid-19 Vaccine Modification
summary: Scientists investigate possible fixes in race to understand blood clots linked to shots. Johnson & Johnson , AstraZeneca PLC and the University of Oxford, along with outside scientists, are conducting early-stage research into whether potential modifications of their Covid-19 vaccines could reduce or eliminate the risk of rare but serious blood clots associated with the shots, according to people close to the process.

title: Solo Cyclist Completes His Alternative Tour de France
summary: Team EF Education-Nippo rider Lachlan Morton completed all 21 stages of the race-and every mile in between-in 18 days, after 220 hours on the bike. When pro cyclist Lachlan Morton set out on his improbable adventure to ride the entire Tour de France route unsupported, even he couldn't be sure he'd make it to Paris. The task ahead of him involved more than 3,200 miles of road. Not only was he riding all 21 stages, he was also covering the distance between them entirely on his bike and without team support.

title: Google Fined $593 Million in France Over Treatment of News Publishers
summary: Regulator says company violated orders to negotiate with publishers for right to show snippets of content in search results. PARIS-France's Competition Authority fined Google $593 million for allegedly violating orders to negotiate paid deals with news publishers, raising pressure on the company in a global fight over how and whether tech companies should pay for news.

title: Mediaocean to Buy Adtech Company Flashtalking for $500 Million
summary: Flashtalking, known for its ad server, is the latest in a string of Mediaocean acquisitions aimed at enhancing its digital ad technology. Mediaocean LLC has agreed to acquire advertising-technology shop Flashtalking, as the company known for its ad-agency billings software adapts to a future dominated by digital media consumption.

title: More Seed Capital for Syngenta Could Help Feed China
summary: Company's coming IPO would provide a boost to STAR Market, as well as another of Beijing's policy objectives: security of food supply. In today's China, companies tend to do well when they match policy makers' appetites. On that score, the coming initial public offering of agricultural giant Syngenta should pique investors' interest.

title: The Other Nightmare Olympics Scenario: Positive Tests for Stars
summary: Covid contact-tracing measures and a packed Tokyo Olympics schedule mean one positive test could risk knocking entire squads from competition. The biggest risk for any country in the Olympic Games in Tokyo this summer is that a single athlete tests positive for the novel coronavirus, but some or all of their team is deemed a close contact-taking everyone out of competition.

title: The Covid-19 Pandemic Hasn't Truly Tested Banks
summary: Government support for the economy meant lenders came through the pandemic with generous capital buffers, leaving questions about how they will perform next time around. Banks have had a good crisis, but that doesn't mean they are fit to weather the next one.

title: Transcript: WSJ Interview With St. Louis Fed President James Bullard
summary: Resume Subscription. Federal Reserve Bank of St. Louis President James Bullard said in an interview Monday with Michael S. Derby of The Wall Street Journal that he is ready for the U.S. central bank to pull back on its asset buying as soon as his colleagues are, and that he is worried that form of Fed aid might be adding fuel to the hot housing market. Mr. Bullard also said he is optimistic about the economic recovery and expects to see around 7% growth this year. The following transcript of the interview has been lightly edited for clarity.

title: Altus Power to Merge With SPAC in $1.58 Billion Deal
summary: The deal gives the solar-power company expansion capital as well as access to CBRE's clients. Altus Power Inc., a builder and operator of solar-power installations on the roofs and parking lots of commercial properties, is merging with a special-purpose acquisition company sponsored by CBRE Group Inc. in a deal that values Altus at $1.58 billion.

title: Customers Are Back at Restaurants and Bars, but Workers Have Moved On
summary: Resume Subscription. Like many servers and bartenders around the country, Ashley Roshitsh, 32 years old, used to love her job-until the pandemic.

title: Return Scams Jump as Fraudsters Exploit E-Commerce Boom
summary: Amazon, Walmart and others are targets of 'item not received' fraud, which surged during pandemic. Retailers say they are seeing a sharp increase in a type of return fraud in which consumers claim they never received their online orders even though they did.

title: Fed's Bullard: Time Is Right to Pull Back on Central Bank Stimulus
summary: 'I am a little bit concerned that we're feeding into an incipient housing bubble,' St. Louis Fed president says. Federal Reserve Bank of St. Louis President James Bullard is ready to start slowing the pace of central bank bond buying as soon as his colleagues are, worried in part that the purchases risk overheating the gangbusters housing market.

title: Related Cos., CareMax Partner Up to Develop Senior Health Centers
summary: Affordable-housing developer to acquire stake in healthcare provider with goal to open about 75 locations in next three years. Related Cos., one of the largest owners of affordable housing in the U.S., is acquiring as much as a 9% stake in healthcare provider CareMax Inc. as part of its plan to develop scores of senior health centers in underserved urban communities throughout the U.S.

title: China's Export Engine Accelerates, Defying Expectations
summary: Outbound shipments increased 32.2% in June from a year earlier in dollar terms, beating economist forecasts. China's imports and exports posted stronger-than-expected growth in June as global demand for Chinese goods remained solid and sporadic Covid-19 outbreaks in the country's biggest export hub didn't hit outbound shipments as much as expected.

title: China Clears Tencent-Sogou Deal
summary: Regulator's approval comes days after it blocked another deal in which Tencent was involved. China's top market watchdog approved Tencent Holdings Ltd. 's plan to privatize search-engine affiliate Sogou Inc. in a deal valued at around $2 billion that comes as the country's technology giants face heightened antitrust scrutiny.

title: Hg to Make $1 Billion Investment in Insightsoftware
summary: The deal values the maker of financial-reporting software at around $4 billion. Hg is investing around $1 billion in private-equity-backed financial-reporting software company insightsoftware, according to a filing made Tuesday with U.K. regulators.

title: Hotel Collapse in Eastern China Kills at Least Eight
summary: Hotel building collapsed Monday afternoon, Suzhou government says. BEIJING-Rescue workers dug through the remains of a collapsed hotel in eastern China looking for any survivors of a disaster that has killed at least eight people and left nine missing, authorities said Tuesday.

title: IFIT to Buy Fitness Platform Sweat for $300 Million Ahead of IPO
summary: NordicTrack owner is expected to fetch a valuation over $7 billion in an IPO this fall. IFIT Health & Fitness Inc. will acquire Sweat, an online fitness training platform, ahead of an initial public offering that is expected in the fall, according to people familiar with the matter.

title: Four Tokyo Olympic Staff Arrested for Suspected Cocaine Use
summary: The four men-two Americans and two British nationals-work for a company that provides electrical-power services for the Games. TOKYO-Two Americans and two British nationals contracted to work for the Tokyo Olympics have been arrested on suspicion of violating drug laws by using cocaine, the police and organizers of the Games said.

title: Pepper...and Salt
summary: Resume Subscription. We are delighted that you'd like to resume your subscription.

title: Democrats Hone Price Tag for Climate and Antipoverty Package
summary: Aides expect plan to be roughly $3 trillion to $4 trillion in size. WASHINGTON-Senate Democrats haggled late Monday over the size and scope of a package including climate provisions, child care and other programs they plan to squeeze through the chamber later this year without any GOP support.

title: Two Haitians Vying for Power Negotiate to Bring Stability, Elections
summary: With the Caribbean nation on the brink of anarchy after its leader's assassination, the prime minister and his chief rival have discussed how to bring calm. Two of the politicians competing for power in Haiti after the assassination of President Jovenel Moïse are close to an agreement that they hope will stabilize the embattled Caribbean nation and lead to fresh elections, one of the politicians involved said.
